definition: in the second place, a part or voice or instrument or orchestra section lower in pitch than or subordinate to the first, the fielding position of the player on a baseball team who is stationed near the second of the bases in the infield, transfer an employee to a different, temporary assignment
details:
adverb
- in the second place
= example: in the second place
= synonyms: secondly
adjective
- a part or voice or instrument or orchestra section lower in pitch than or subordinate to the first
= example: a part or voice or instrument or orchestra section lower in pitch than or subordinate to the first
- coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude
noun
- the fielding position of the player on a baseball team who is stationed near the second of the bases in the infield
= synonyms: second base
- merchandise that has imperfections
= synonyms: irregular
- the gear that has the second lowest forward gear ratio in the gear box of a motor vehicle
= example: the gear that has the second lowest forward gear ratio in the gear box of a motor vehicle
- a speech seconding a motion
= example: a speech seconding a motion
= synonyms: secondment
- the official attendant of a contestant in a duel or boxing match
- a 60th part of a minute of arc
= example: a 60th part of a minute of arc
= synonyms: arcsecond
- following the first in an ordering or series
= example: following the first in an ordering or series
- 1/60 of a minute
= synonyms: sec, s
- a particular point in time
= synonyms: minute, instant, moment
- an indefinitely short time
= synonyms: minute, bit, moment, mo
verb
- transfer an employee to a different, temporary assignment
= example: transfer an employee to a different, temporary assignment
- give support or one's approval to
= example: give support or one's approval to
= synonyms: back
